title: Changed behaviour in drag&drop to DOck on MacOS
content:
On macOS the previous behaviour in Firefox was that the text content from the drag&drop was sent to the application I dropped to (and still works this way when doing so to the open application). But now Firefox downloads the image preview that I use to enable the drag&drop with into a temp folder, giving it a serial name. Is there any setting to revert back to the old behaviour? And if, not can you implement one please?

Regards, Åke Samuelson

title: A website I visit daily is not opening properly in Firefox
content:
Hi everyone, I visit Rojgar--result, website almost every day to check the latest job updates. But from the last few days, the website is not opening properly in my Firefox browser. Sometimes it takes too long to load, and sometimes the page looks broken.

When I open the same website in other browsers like Chrome or Edge, it works fine. So I think the problem might be with Firefox.

Can anyone please tell me if there is any simple setting or update that can fix this? Has anyone else faced this kind of issue before?

title: Secure Connection Failed  -- Error code: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR
content: Repeatedly, repeatedly, repeatedly get SECURE CONNECTION FAILED - An error occurred during a connection to xxxxxxxx.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR Error code: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified. Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem. There are few attempted web sites that do not get blocked with this message -- EVEN WWW.FIREFOX.COM. I've tried downloading an update to Firefox, but have problems with doing it -- have often gotten the above notice even when trying to download update! Keep getting "Update Failed". Have no trouble accessing any sites using Safari. I'm running a late 2012 21" iMac with macOS Catalina Version 10.15.7
creator: akrupp

title: Video decoding performance is significantly lower than that of other Chromium-based browsers.
content:
In Firefox, When H264 frames are decoded and rendered within a single tab, the output reaches up to 180 fps, performing well and meeting expectations. When decoding and rendering occur on two separate tabs on parallel, performance significantly drops, impacting both processes. However, it performs smoothly when running on a single tab.

In comparison to the Brave browser, H264 decoding and rendering are noticeably slower in Firefox. Firefox manages only around 180 fps, while Brave and other Chromium-based browsers can achieve approximately 1000 fps on a single tab and around 800 fps when multiple tabs are open.


Document Link : https://workdrive.zohoexternal.in/external/writer/999ecda6e3a0b1ed2d4629c8480a6c1d595764234c29563e5bc8aa530cfbc431
creator: harie20202

title: High GPU Usage in Firefox When Playing Danmaku on bilibili.com (2019 MacBook Pro)
content:
On my 2019 16-inch MacBook Pro equipped with dual GPUs, enabling danmaku (on-screen comments) while playing videos on bilibili.com causes a sudden spike in GPU usage, leading to significant heating. The issue disappears when danmaku is disabled.

Additional notes: 1. This problem does not occur in Safari or Chrome. 2. "Use recommended performance settings" is already enabled in Firefox. 3. Reinstalling Firefox did not resolve the issue.

What can I do to fix this?

title: pingsender
content:
Hi. I'm on Tahoe since 24 hours. I have Lulu installed. Lulu blocked an outgoing connection called ping sender that wants to connect to 34.120.208.123 and is related to Mozilla as Lulu says. But when I run a whois on this ip I get

NetRange: 34.64.0.0 - 34.127.255.255 CIDR: 34.64.0.0/10 NetName: GOOGL-2 NetHandle: NET-34-64-0-0-1 Parent: NET34 (NET-34-0-0-0-0) NetType: Direct Allocation OriginAS: Organization: Google LLC (GOOGL-2) RegDate: 2018-09-28 Updated: 2018-09-28 Ref: https://rdap.arin.net/registry/ip/34.64.0.0


OrgName: Google LLC OrgId: GOOGL-2 Address: 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway City: Mountain View StateProv: CA PostalCode: 94043 Country: US RegDate: 2006-09-29 Updated: 2019-11-01 Comment: *** The IP addresses under this Org-ID are in use by Google Cloud customers *** Comment: Comment: Direct all copyright and legal complaints to Comment: https://support.google.com/legal/go/report

In Lulu I have ▪ /Applications/Firefox Developer Edition.app/Contents/MacOS/pingsender


WTF?????????
